qas.question: Who was the ruler in Morocco?
When did Sultan Ahmad al-Mansur rule?
What Arabic term is still used for black people?
Who still had the term "slave" used in reference to them?

context: Some succeeded their fathers as rulers, such as <a0_0>Sultan Ahmad al-Mansur<a0_0/>, who ruled Morocco <a1_0>from 1578 to 1608<a1_0/>. He was not technically considered as a mixed-race child of a slave; his mother was <a2_0>Fulani<a2_0/> and a concubine of his father. Such tolerance for black persons, even when technically "free", was not so common in Morocco. The long association of <a4_0>sub-Saharan peoples<a4_0/> as slaves is shown in the term abd <a3_0>(Arabic: عبد‎,) (meaning "slave")<a3_0/>; it is still frequently used in the Arabic-speaking world as a term for black people.
